00068 typedef enum
00069 {
00070   JP2_STATE_NONE            = 0x0,
00071   JP2_STATE_SIGNATURE       = 0x1,
00072   JP2_STATE_FILE_TYPE       = 0x2,
00073   JP2_STATE_HEADER          = 0x4,
00074   JP2_STATE_CODESTREAM      = 0x8,
00075   JP2_STATE_END_CODESTREAM  = 0x10,
00076   JP2_STATE_UNKNOWN         = 0x7fffffff /* ISO C restricts enumerator values to range of 'int' */
00077 }
00078 JP2_STATE;
00079 
00080 typedef enum
00081 {
00082   JP2_IMG_STATE_NONE        = 0x0,
00083   JP2_IMG_STATE_UNKNOWN     = 0x7fffffff
00084 }
00085 JP2_IMG_STATE;

00151 typedef struct opj_jp2
00152 {
00154   opj_j2k_t *j2k;
00156   struct opj_procedure_list * m_validation_list;
00158   struct opj_procedure_list * m_procedure_list;
00159 
00160   /* width of image */
00161   OPJ_UINT32 w;
00162   /* height of image */
00163   OPJ_UINT32 h;
00164   /* number of components in the image */
00165   OPJ_UINT32 numcomps;
00166   OPJ_UINT32 bpc;
00167   OPJ_UINT32 C;
00168   OPJ_UINT32 UnkC;
00169   OPJ_UINT32 IPR;
00170   OPJ_UINT32 meth;
00171   OPJ_UINT32 approx;
00172   OPJ_UINT32 enumcs;
00173   OPJ_UINT32 precedence;
00174   OPJ_UINT32 brand;
00175   OPJ_UINT32 minversion;
00176   OPJ_UINT32 numcl;
00177   OPJ_UINT32 *cl;
00178   opj_jp2_comps_t *comps;
00179   /* FIXME: The following two variables are used to save offset
00180     as we write out a JP2 file to disk. This mecanism is not flexible
00181     as codec writers will need to extand those fields as new part
00182     of the standard are implemented.
00183   */
00184     OPJ_OFF_T j2k_codestream_offset;
00185     OPJ_OFF_T jpip_iptr_offset;
00186         OPJ_BOOL jpip_on;
00187   OPJ_UINT32 jp2_state;
00188   OPJ_UINT32 jp2_img_state;
00189 
00190   opj_jp2_color_t color;
00191     
00192     OPJ_BOOL ignore_pclr_cmap_cdef;
00193 }

00205 typedef struct opj_jp2_header_handler
00206 {
00207   /* marker value */
00208   OPJ_UINT32 id;
00209   /* action linked to the marker */
00210   OPJ_BOOL (*handler) (     opj_jp2_t *jp2, 
00211                             OPJ_BYTE *p_header_data, 
00212                             OPJ_UINT32 p_header_size, 
00213                             opj_event_mgr_t * p_manager);
00214 }
00215 opj_jp2_header_handler_t;
00216

00218 typedef struct opj_jp2_img_header_writer_handler 
00219 {
00220   /* action to perform */
00221   OPJ_BYTE*   (*handler) (opj_jp2_t *jp2, OPJ_UINT32 * p_data_size);
00222   /* result of the action : data */
00223   OPJ_BYTE*   m_data;
00224   /* size of data */
00225   OPJ_UINT32  m_size;
00226 } 
00227 opj_jp2_img_header_writer_handler_t;
